definitions: small enclosed field or pasture near stable for horses or livestock
enclosed area at racing venue where horses are paraded before racing
examples: The mare grazed peacefully in the paddock behind the barn
They repaired the fence around the paddock before winter arrived
Spectators gathered at the paddock to watch the horses parade
The jockey mounted his horse in the paddock before the race

definitions: flooded field used for growing rice in Asia and elsewhere
informal name for someone of Irish descent, sometimes considered offensive
examples: The farmers worked tirelessly in the paddy during planting season
Water buffalo waded through the flooded paddy fields at sunset
His friends called him Paddy though his real name was Patrick
The old Paddy wagon transported prisoners to the courthouse

definitions: detachable lock with hinged shackle passed through rings or staple
examples: She secured the shed with a heavy-duty padlock every night
The padlock on the gate had rusted from years of rain

definitions: medical doctor specialized in treating infants, children, and adolescents until adulthood
examples: The paediatrician examined the baby during the routine checkup appointment
Parents consulted the paediatrician about their child's developmental milestones

definitions: adult who has persistent sexual interest in or commits crimes against children
examples: The convicted paedophile was placed on the sex offender registry
Police investigated the suspected paedophile after receiving multiple complaints

definitions: person holding religious beliefs other than main world religions, especially nature worship
person regarded as lacking religion or having unconventional spiritual beliefs
examples: Ancient pagans celebrated the winter solstice with elaborate rituals
The missionary sought to convert the pagans to Christianity
Her grandmother called him a pagan for never attending church
Modern pagans practice various forms of earth-centered spirituality

definitions: religious practices and beliefs outside mainstream religions, often polytheistic or nature-based
examples: Paganism flourished in Europe before the spread of Christianity
Modern paganism includes various earth-centered spiritual traditions and practices

definitions: one side of a sheet of paper in a book or document
single document or screen of information on a website
young person employed as personal or ceremonial attendant
act of calling someone through announcement or electronic device
examples: She bookmarked the page containing her favorite poem
The manuscript totaled over three hundred pages
The company's home page displays their latest products and services
Click the link to navigate to the next page
The page carried the queen's train during the coronation ceremony
Medieval pages trained to become knights in noble households
They paged the doctor to the emergency room immediately
The receptionist paged him over the intercom system

definitions: elaborate public display or procession with costumes depicting historical events
competition where contestants are judged on appearance, talent, and personality
examples: The medieval pageant recreated the town's founding with elaborate costumes
Children performed in the Christmas pageant at the local church
She won the beauty pageant with her talent and poise
The Miss Universe pageant attracts contestants from around the world

definitions: elaborate, colorful, and splendid display or ceremony with formal proceedings
examples: The coronation ceremony featured all the pageantry of royal tradition
Military parades showcase the pageantry of national pride and heritage

definitions: small electronic device that receives and displays numeric or text messages
examples: Doctors carried pagers to receive emergency calls from the hospital
The old pager beeped with an urgent message from dispatch

definitions: computer memory management scheme storing and retrieving data from secondary storage
system of calling or summoning someone through electronic devices or announcements
examples: The operating system uses paging to manage virtual memory efficiently
Paging allows programs to use more memory than physically available
The hospital's paging system alerted staff to emergencies quickly
Overhead paging in the store announced the closing time

definitions: multi-tiered tower with upward-curving roofs, common in Asian religious architecture
examples: The ancient pagoda stood seven stories tall overlooking the valley
Tourists photographed the golden pagoda at the Buddhist temple complex

definitions: cylindrical container with handle for carrying liquids or materials
examples: She carried water from the well in a wooden pail
The child filled his pail with sand at the beach

definitions: unpleasant physical sensation caused by injury, illness, or harmful stimuli
mental or emotional suffering, distress, or anguish
informal term for annoying or troublesome person or thing
examples: The sharp pain in her knee made walking difficult
He took medication to relieve the chronic back pain
The pain of losing a loved one never completely fades
Their separation caused both of them tremendous emotional pain
That noisy neighbor is such a pain to deal with
Getting through airport security can be a real pain

definitions: drug or medicine used to relieve or reduce pain
examples: The doctor prescribed strong painkillers after the surgery
Over-the-counter painkillers helped manage her headache symptoms

definitions: liquid substance applied to surfaces to color, protect, or decorate
cosmetic makeup, especially when heavily or obviously applied
examples: They bought several gallons of paint to redecorate the house
The artist mixed different colors of paint on her palette
The actor removed the stage paint after the performance
She wore too much paint on her face for the photograph

definitions: competitive team sport where players shoot capsules of paint at opponents
examples: They played paintball at the outdoor arena every weekend
His paintball gear included protective masks and camouflage clothing

definitions: brush with bristles used for applying paint to surfaces
examples: The artist selected a fine paintbrush for the detailed work
He cleaned the paintbrush thoroughly after finishing the project

definitions: person who creates art using paint as primary medium
person whose job involves painting buildings, walls, or structures
examples: The painter exhibited her landscapes at the downtown gallery
Famous painters like Van Gogh struggled for recognition during their lifetimes
They hired a professional painter to repaint the entire house
The painter carefully taped the edges before applying the coat

definitions: artwork created using paint on canvas, paper, or other surface
activity or occupation of coating surfaces with paint
examples: The painting sold for millions at the prestigious art auction
She admired the Renaissance paintings in the museum collection
Painting the house took them the entire weekend to complete
He learned painting techniques at the vocational training school

definitions: set of two similar or corresponding things used together
two people or animals regarded as a unit or couple
examples: She bought a new pair of running shoes for the marathon
The pair of gloves matched her winter coat perfectly
The pair worked together on the research project for months
A pair of swans nested by the lake every spring

definitions: act or process of matching or combining two things together
combination of two things that complement or work well together
examples: The pairing of students for the project happened randomly
Careful pairing of wines with dishes enhances the dining experience
The pairing of chocolate and raspberry creates a delicious flavor
Their pairing as business partners proved highly successful

definitions: intricate pattern of curved teardrop shapes, originally from Persian and Indian designs
examples: Her silk scarf featured an elegant paisley design in blues
The vintage paisley tie belonged to his grandfather's collection

definitions: loose-fitting garments worn for sleeping, typically consisting of pants and top
examples: The children changed into their pajamas before bedtime story
She bought silk pajamas as a luxurious gift for herself

definitions: informal term for close friend or companion
examples: His old pal from college visited him last weekend
The two pals spent hours playing video games together

definitions: official residence of sovereign, archbishop, or other high-ranking person
large, impressive building used for entertainment or specific purpose
examples: The queen's palace overlooked the capital city's main square
Tourists lined up to tour the historic palace and gardens
The movie palace from the 1920s still shows classic films
They dined at the ice cream palace downtown

definitions: roof of the mouth separating oral and nasal cavities
person's ability to distinguish and appreciate different flavors
examples: The dentist examined her palate for signs of infection
The cleft palate required surgical correction in infancy
Wine tasters develop a refined palate through years of practice
The chef's dishes appeal to the most sophisticated palate

definitions: wooden stake or post used as upright in fence or boundary marker
examples: The old pale marked the edge of the medieval settlement
They drove pales into the ground to create a defensive barrier

definitions: scientist who studies prehistoric life through examination of plant and animal fossils
examples: The paleontologist discovered a new dinosaur species in Montana
Young paleontologists often start by volunteering on excavation sites

definitions: scientific study of life in past geological periods through fossil examination
examples: Paleontology combines biology and geology to understand ancient life
The museum's paleontology department houses thousands of fossil specimens

definitions: flat board on which artist mixes colors for painting
range or selection of colors used in particular context
examples: The artist arranged fresh paint on her wooden palette
He scraped the dried paint off his palette with a knife
The designer chose an autumn palette for the new collection
The film's color palette emphasized blues and grays

definitions: word, phrase, or sequence that reads the same backward as forward
examples: The word 'radar' is a simple palindrome in English
She enjoyed creating palindromes like 'A man, a plan, a canal, Panama'

definitions: fence of wooden stakes or iron railings forming enclosure or defense
line of high cliffs, especially along a river
examples: The fort's palisade protected settlers from attacks
They reinforced the palisade with additional wooden stakes
The Palisades along the Hudson River create dramatic scenery
Hikers enjoyed views from the top of the palisade

definitions: cloth spread over coffin, hearse, or tomb during funeral
dark cloud or covering of smoke, dust, or similar matter
examples: The ceremonial pall covered the coffin during the service
Six pallbearers held the corners of the velvet pall
A pall of smoke hung over the burning building
The tragedy cast a pall over the celebration

definitions: rare silvery-white metallic element used in electronics and jewelry
something regarded as providing protection or safety
examples: Palladium prices surged due to increased demand from automakers
The jeweler crafted wedding rings from palladium and diamonds
Freedom of speech remains a palladium of democracy
The constitution serves as a palladium of civil liberties

definitions: portable platform for storing or moving goods with forklift
simple straw-filled mattress or makeshift bed
examples: The warehouse stored boxes on wooden pallets for easy transport
The forklift operator moved pallets of merchandise to the truck
Refugees slept on pallets in the temporary shelter
He made a pallet on the floor for his guest

definitions: medical care or treatment that relieves symptoms without curing underlying condition
examples: Palliative care improved the patient's quality of life significantly
The hospice provided palliative treatment for terminal cancer patients

definitions: inner surface of hand between wrist and fingers
tropical tree with unbranched trunk topped with large leaves
examples: She held the tiny bird gently in her palm
The fortune teller studied the lines on his palm
Coconut palms lined the tropical beach resort
Date palms have been cultivated for thousands of years

definitions: horse with golden or cream-colored coat and white mane and tail
examples: The palomino stallion gleamed like gold in the sunlight
She rode her palomino in the western pleasure competition

definitions: paralysis or uncontrollable tremor of body parts, especially from neurological damage
examples: Cerebral palsy affected his motor skills from birth
The elderly man's palsy made his hands shake uncontrollably

definitions: small booklet or leaflet containing information or arguments about single subject
examples: The health clinic distributed pamphlets about disease prevention
Political pamphlets were handed out before the election

definitions: metal container used for cooking food on stove or in oven
harsh criticism or negative review of performance or work
examples: She heated oil in the pan before adding vegetables
The non-stick pan made cooking eggs much easier
Critics gave the movie a harsh pan in their reviews
The play received pans from every major newspaper

definitions: solution or remedy claimed to solve all problems or cure all diseases
examples: Technology is not a panacea for all educational challenges
Politicians promised their plan was a panacea for economic woes

definitions: distinctive and flamboyant confidence of style or manner
examples: She performed the difficult piece with remarkable panache
The chef presented each dish with theatrical panache

definitions: thin, flat cake made from batter and cooked on griddle
examples: She made fluffy pancakes with maple syrup for breakfast
The diner served enormous stacks of blueberry pancakes

definitions: large bear native to China with distinctive black and white markings
examples: The giant panda munched bamboo at the zoo
Conservation efforts helped increase the wild panda population

definitions: disease outbreak affecting large populations across countries or continents worldwide
examples: The COVID-19 pandemic changed how people work and socialize
Historical pandemics like the Spanish flu killed millions worldwide

definitions: wild and noisy disorder or confusion; uproar and chaos
examples: Pandemonium erupted when the concert was suddenly cancelled
The classroom descended into pandemonium when the teacher left

definitions: single sheet of glass in window or door frame
examples: The baseball shattered the window pane into pieces
Frost covered the panes of glass on winter mornings
